title: Ticket #7046: CREDD_OAUTH_MODE on by default
description: Until the different modes of the credd are merged, we should start using the OAuth mode (i.e. SciTokens mode) by default so admins don't have to enable it machine-by-machine. Users that are still using the old mode should be notified, though this will only go in the dev release for now, Hopefully both modes will be supported simultaneously w/o any config by the time we get to the next major stable release.
remarks:
2019-May-10 14:23:57 by jpatton:
Modified the scope of this ticket as Zach may have found a way to get around having to use CREDD_OAUTH_MODE.

2019-May-10 16:17:49 by jpatton:
After discussion, it appears (for now) that we still need to set CREDD_OAUTH_MODE = TRUE on the submit side to get the correct behavior for local signed tokens (e.g. ones that have the credd [or is it submit?] invoke the SEC_CREDENTIAL_PRODUCER). Added in [56855]

2019-May-29 10:37:51 by zmiller:
CERN and DESY were both notified of this change in default. Doing something more intelligent has been pushed off to a future version, and may become moot if/when the two modes are merged as described in #7086
